pl.edu.agh.icsr.janet.util
Interface Region

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BooleanRegion, ByteRegion, CharRegion, DoubleRegion, FloatRegion, IntRegion, LongRegion, ShortRegion
public interface Region
extends java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Represents a contiguous region in an array of some primitive type. The region may be empty, or it may refer to the whole array. This class may be used for passing "pointers into the middle of arrays" to native methods.

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object baseArrayAsObject()
          Returns the base array as object.
 int endIdx()
          Returns the offset in the base array where the region ends.
 boolean isEmpty()
          Tests if the region is empty (has a length of 0).
 int length()
          Returns the length of the region.
 int offset()
          Returns the offset in the base array where the region starts.
 int startIdx()
          The same as offset().
